Each Graviton3 package
has 55 billion transistors
and is made up of seven chiplets,
one main compute die in the center,
four DRAM controller dies on the edge,
and two PCI-e dies.

We elected to implement
Graviton3 as a multichip module
to reduce costs and to increase yields

as the size and complexity
of modern server processors
continues to grow.
This improves manufacturing economics,

but it also allows future
Gravitons to be fabricated

using a leading process
node, while at the same time,

for example, the PCI-e
die, can remain unchanged.
Unlike some contemporary server CPUs,
the Graviton3 compute die is monolithic.
All 64 cores are on that single die.
This allows us to deliver 64 cores
with uniform memory access latencies,

rather than exposing to

the complexity of managing different
local and remote memory accesses.
